nav.div: Windham School District » What's New » Special Health Advisory: COVID-19

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Special Health Advisory: COVID-19

div.img:
The district has continued to stay in contact with the NH Division of Public Health Services regarding additional information and guidance for COVID-19. Based on their advisory, we are requesting that any student, staff, and/or volunteer who has recently traveled to any of the countries on the CDC’s Level 3 list; currently Italy, Iran, South Korea, and China, notify Student Services at 603-845-1550 x1131 immediately. Please notify Student Services whether or not you are currently symptomatic. We thank our school community in advance for their cooperation and diligence in this matter.
Travelers returning from one of the Level 3 countries are being advised to be self-quarantined for 14-days upon return. If you have any questions about any upcoming international travel to a high-risk country, you can also contact the Student Services office for guidance.
Moving forward, the Windham School District will continue to remain in frequent contact with state health experts to stay abreast of this situation, and we will act based on their recommendations. Any additional information that we receive from the experts will be sent to our school community.
The health and safety of our school community is always of paramount concern. We will continue to use the guidance and information from our state health departments, and respond accordingly, to keep our community safe.
Thank you,
Windham School District
